original: Cambodia has a rich and intricate history of textile production that dates back to the late 13th century. Historical accounts, such as those by the Chinese diplomat Zhou Daguan, provide insight into the traditional practices of the time. Zhou noted that local inhabitants primarily engaged in weaving cotton from Kapok, lacking the skills for silk production. He described their weaving method as rudimentary, stating, "They do not use a lo
